title: How to Make Your Temporary Facebook Profile Picture Last Longer or Shorter

steps.title: Go to your Facebook profile in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to your Facebook profile in a web browser. Go to https://www.facebook.com and click your profile picture at the top of the menu on the left side of your feed. This will take you to your profile. It's not possible to change your temporary profile photo's expiration date in the Facebook mobile app, so you'll have to use a web browser. In order for this to work, you will first need to set a temporary profile picture in the mobile app. Go to your profile, tap your profile picture, and select Choose profile picture . Select a picture and tap Make Temporary , then choose from either 1 hour or 1 day for the expiration time.

steps.title: Click your temporary profile picture.
steps.content: Click your temporary profile picture. Find your profile picture at the top left side of your profile. Click directly on the picture, not on the camera icon at the bottom of the picture. A menu of options will pop up.

steps.title: Choose Change end time.
steps.content: Choose Change end time . This will be the third option in the pop-up menu that appears above your profile picture. To immediately switch back to your previous profile picture or make your temporary picture permanent, choose Switch to previous picture now or Keep as permanent picture from the pop-up menu instead. If you don't see these options, try refreshing the page. Double-check that you've set a temporary profile picture in the mobile app.

steps.title: Enter a new end date and time.
steps.content: Enter a new end date and time. You can change the date and time by clicking in each box and typing the new value or selecting an option from each dropdown menu that appears.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . You have now successfully changed when your temporary profile picture will expire!
